documents.document: @BJDugdale @JoelRowan I bet he knows more about all of this than I do

Tracey Martin both support Te Reo - airport encounter https://t.co/BwNHE5f0Dt
@thelittlepakeha @bootstheory @actparty Shirley Maihi school principal explained how two languages expand kids learning, especially Te Reo
@thelittlepakeha @bootstheory @actparty not substantiated by experience or research, it's the opposite, kids thrive
@thelittlepakeha time to catch up and value the unique Reo of Aotearoa, language learning should be core to build confident learners
@bootstheory @actparty one of few countries not to teach and value bilingualism, our kids miss out, we missed out on Te Reo
Looking forward to learning from Te Reo experts and teachers how to make Te Reo universal, step one- commit to action and sign the petition
At Finlayson Park School to launch our commitment to universal Te Reo
LAWA web site will tell you about swimming spots immediate safety but not the overall health of your much loved rivers
@ThomedySci it's about agriculture and control of seeds, and only studies are on animal pops which have shown adverse results
Nick Smith pretends local govt trying to stop GM medicine use not crops, disingenuous, tramples on people wanting safe food
Who was carefully monitoring the Havelock water bores before outbreak? Doesn't sound rigorous to say the least
@DennyPaoa we need to re examine the whole kaupapa and recognise that its Tamaki Makaurau
Yesterday was Ak Anniversary day, what was that about? love holidays but not colonial provincial legacy no one questions meaning of day?
@springsteen @DoingOurBitNZ great spirit but please recognise US has indigenous people, not immigrants and not valued either

@rosbritton exactly
Not very keen on 4 year olds starting school to keep things tidy, cohort entry should not mean starting before 5 years old

@ssheere01 @HypnoKiwi @grumpybirb absolutely agree!
@ssheere01 @grumpybirb i would be keen to know how this works!
@grumpybirb i agree, its a rip off for people who need to feed and clothe more than one child, plus " donations"
The back to school costs are too much for many families, we need to fund schools better and make uniforms cheaper

@ccwnz @nzherald common sense for a change?
@LizzieMarvelly @miriampierard exactly, thanks for great speech Saturday, so great to hear mihi to tangata whenua, naming toxic patriarchy

@Mihi_Forbes but PM said Govt has reached its limit on what it can do on poverty, how can we unite with that statement?

Bill English says "Govt reached its limits" on what it can be done about poverty, I really had to laugh out loud

Very sorry to hear of the passing of Percy Tipene, Te Tai Tokerau organic kai champion, arohanui whanau me hapu katoa
@RFStew good on Morgan but Greens have had a polluters pays water policy forever w
@RFStew 5 years better than an indefinite exemption, time to create carbon sinks and reduce stock numbers, PKE imports etc
@RFStew change NPS/NOF, reduce stock numbers, restore organic agriculture support cut by Nats,real penalties for pollution, price on water
@RFStew i have said there are just too many cows in many interviews, but you are right that we have not put % reduction figure on it
@RFStew he would have if we had actually disputed the need for less cows, but we never have, we support it
@RFStew yep less cows, less Pke and fertilisers, agriculture can sustain itself without massive debt, water can heal, urgent changed needed
@RFStew tax part of the plan, we need to restructure agriculture to sustainable,
@RFStew I checked with James, he did not say reducing stock numbers unviable, of course we support stock reduction and a plan to do it
